intro: Coelachne simpliciuscula, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that appear in clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
